statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Lafayette 93, American 89
article.story: EASTON, Pa. (AP) -- Jamaal Hilliard scored 23 points and Marcus Harley had 22, both career highs, to lead Lafayette to a 93-89 overtime win over American on Saturday. Sean Knitter added 17 points for Lafayette (8-17, 4-8 Patriot League) while Jamaal Douglas scored 11 points and Bilal Abdullah added 10. Andre Ingram scored 37 points for American (13-11, 6-6) and Jason Thomas scored 18 points while Raimonda Petrauskas added 12. Lafayette led for the entire extra period, but Ingram hit a 3-pointer to get American within 91-89 with eight seconds left. Hilliard, who was 11-for-11 from the free throw line, hit two free throws to seal the win. Hilliard also sank two free throws to put Lafayette up 80-78 with eight seconds left in regulation, but Linas Lekavicius hit a layup with 2.8 seconds to go to send the game into overtime. Ingram hit a 3-pointer to give the Eagles a 76-67 lead with 3:43 left in regulation, but Hilliard's basket and three foul shots, along with a pair from the line from both Abdullah and Jamaal Douglas, tied the score 76-76 with 1:50 remaining. Jason Thomas then scored for American but Sean Knitter made two free throws with 55 seconds left for the game's seventh tie. Harley scored 14 points in the first half and Lafayette went on an 11-1 run late in the period to pull ahead 43-35, but Ingram hit a 3-pointer with 19 seconds left to make the score 43-38 at the half.
